author: deaconknives
post_text: January 21, 2016 at 3:34 AM#1Hi, wondering how to name a SetVar (which is the name of a preset), and then use that SetVar to recall it...Something like:SetVar $currentcolor=REDAt Preset 4."$currentcolor"This doesn't work as it put the Var in quotation marks, where I just want to put the result in quotation marks if that makes sense...Thanks

posts.author: deaconknives
posts.post_text: January 21, 2016 at 3:34 AM#1Hi, wondering how to name a SetVar (which is the name of a preset), and then use that SetVar to recall it...Something like:SetVar $currentcolor=REDAt Preset 4."$currentcolor"This doesn't work as it put the Var in quotation marks, where I just want to put the result in quotation marks if that makes sense...Thanks

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: January 21, 2016 at 10:58 AM#2use :  at preset 4.$"currentcolor"if you color name is just RED, BLUE or any single name which is not a command, you don't need quotes:at preset 4.RED is ok,at preset 4.DARK RED or at preset 4.ON RED are not > 4."dark red" , 4."on red" okremember that value name are not case sensitive : RED = red = Red = rED etc...

posts.author: deaconknives
posts.post_text: January 21, 2016 at 10:48 PM#3Thanks, but I dont think this will work as i'm using numbers for the names of my presets - eg. 2200 K = "2200"Idea is that the LD can press a group, press the macro which asks for a color temp - they type it and it goes to the preset of the same name.

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: January 22, 2016 at 1:53 PM#4first post you wrote : color "red"To avoid number confusion here is what i do :my color names are labelling like : _2200Then in your macro:setvar $col = "_"addvar $col = (which color ?)  -----> $col = _2200at preset 4.$"col"and it works fineyou can replace _ by any sign not use as a command (ie: L, Lee, Col, K etc...)Enjoy

posts.author: Wsiilva
posts.post_text: February 8, 2016 at 10:44 PM#5i know a better waytipsetvar$mypreset="selfix preset"-- know go into macro window and edit a empty macro and type this$mypreset ( "what preset?")-- preset are knowing by dot like 1.1 dimer 2.1 position so far and so on-- doing that you can call any preset  on any giving time

title: Set Var AND Referencing Name ""
